Notice of Non-Discrimination
Frederick County Public Schools shall not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual
orientation, gender, gender identity, age, political af�liation, disability, military status, marital status, pregnancy, childbirth or related
medical conditions, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by law in the education program and activities, or
employment and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups.
Questions concerning the application of this nondiscrimination policy may be made to: Title IX Coordinator (Adults), Katie Freakley,
Executive Director of Human Resources; Title IX Coordinator (Students) and Section 504 Coordinator, Teresa Ritenour, Director of
Student Support Services.
For further information on notice of nondiscrimination, see list of OCR enforcement of�ces for the addresses and phone numbers of
the of�ce that serves your area, or call 1-800-421-3481.

data.col_1:
How to Navigate this Budget Document
The School Board Approved Budget describes the school division’s budget development, management, and processes. It includes �nancial
information for the current budget year as well as comparison data for previous �scal years. The document’s format follows the standards set forth
by the Association of School Business Of�cials International Meritorious Budget Award Program, as well as the Government Finance Of�cers
Association Distinguished Budget Presentation Awards Program. The purpose of this budget document is to provide policy information, to serve as
an operational guide and �nancial plan, and to communicate �scal practices with the school division’s stakeholders, including parents, students,
staff, constituents, and elected of�cials. Throughout this document, Frederick County Public Schools is referenced by the abbreviation FCPS. Due to
rounding, numbers in charts and tables may not add precisely.
The Superintendent's Proposed Budget for Fiscal Year 2024-2025 is divided into four sections:
�. The EXECUTIVE SUMMARY provides a comprehensive overview of the leadership and organization, as well as a �nancial picture of the school
district's budget for FY25, and can be presented separately as a highlight of the entire budget document. Information in this summary is
included in and expanded upon in the following major sections: Organizational, Financial, and Informational.
�. The ORGANIZATIONAL SECTION explains the direction, management and regulatory structure, strategic plans, and the budget process of the
school division. The leadership team is introduced, along with an overview of FCPS' mission and goals, especially as connected to costs. The
school district's major goals and objectives are explained, with a description of the budget process and timeline. The division's accounting
structure and �nancial practices are addressed, to include a description of revenue sources.
�. The FINANCIAL SECTION presents budget data district-wide and by fund, in summary and by detail. Three years of historical �nancial data,
the current year’s budget, and next year’s proposed budget, as well as a three-year forecast of projected revenues and expenditures are
presented. Trends and initiatives are explained. An overview of each department’s contributions is provided.
�. The INFORMATIONAL SECTION shares student enrollment analysis and projection methodology and the resulting impact on the number of
positions FCPS needs to operate. This section also provides information on local taxes and economy, cost of education, and school division
accountability. A glossary of terms and acronyms is included at the end.
These sections are shown at the top of the webpage. To access the detailed information in each section, click on the title for each page. You must
manually click on each section, as the full budget document is not available by scrolling. Obtain a printed copy by clicking on the PDF icon; once
compiled, the printed version will be sent to an email address as provided.
For additional information, visit the "About - Budget" page of the Frederick County Public Schools' website at www.frederickcountyschoolssva.net.
Frederick County Public Schools, Winchester, VA | FY 2025 Approved Budget Page 7

data.col_1:
Frederick County Public Schools Budget Awards
Frederick County Public Schools is proud to be recognized for accuracy and transparency in our budget process and �scal
responsibility. Upon our �rst submission to the Government Finance Of�cers Association of the United States and Canada
(GFOA), FCPS was presented a Distinguished Budget Presentation Award for the Annual Budget for the �scal year ending
June 30, 2024. To receive this award, a governmental unit must publish a budget document that meets program criteria as a
policy document, �nancial plan, operations guide, and communications device. The GFOA award is the highest form of
recognition in governmental budgeting.
Additionally, Frederick County Public Schools was awarded the Meritorious Budget Award for excellence in the preparation
and issuance of the Fiscal Year 2023-2024 budget, presented by the Association of School Business Of�cials International
(ASBO). ASBO International’s MBA and Pathway to the MBA promote and recognize best budget presentation practices in
school districts. Participants submit their applications and budget documents to a panel of school �nancial professionals who
review the materials for compliance with the MBA Criteria Checklist and other requirements and provide expert feedback that
districts can use to improve their budget documents. “Districts that apply to the MBA or Pathway to the MBA programs
recognize the importance of presenting a high-quality, easy-to-understand budget internally and to the community,” ASBO
International Executive Director David J. Lewis explains. The Frederick County Public Schools Annual Budget has continuously
received this award for the past 11 years.
Pictured Below: Dr. Hummer, Superintendent, meets with the Student Advisory Committee in February 2024.
